data.title: Famous People From Saint Petersburg, Russia & Celebs Born In Saint Petersburg
data.meta_description: Saint Petersburg has produced a number of famous personalities, including emperors & kings, poets, actors, political leaders, football players etc.
data.text:
1

Ayn Rand

(Writer and Philosopher Known for Her Best-Selling Novels ‘The Fountainhead’ and ‘Atlas Shrugged’)

56

46

Listed In: Writers

Birthdate: February 2, 1905

Sun Sign: Aquarius

Died: March 6, 1982

Ayn Rand was a Russian-American philosopher and writer. Apart from publishing two best-selling novels, Ayn Rand is credited with developing a philosophical system called Objectivism. Over the years, Ayn Rand has been a major influence among American conservatives and libertarians. Some of the famous personalities influenced by her include Amber Heard, Vince Vaughn, Jimmy Wales, Ayelet Shaked, and Mary Ruwart.

2

Vladimir Nabokov

(Best Known For His Novels 'Lolita' and 'Pale Fire')

35

9

Listed In: Writers

Birthdate: April 23, 1899

Sun Sign: Taurus

Died: July 2, 1977

Russian author Vladimir Nabokov, also known by his pen name, Vladimir Sirin, is best remembered for his controversial novel Lolita. His other works include the novel Pale Fire and his memoir, Speak, Memory. He was also an entomologist, specializing in lepidoptery. He also liked composing chess problems.

3

Vladimir Putin

(President of Russia (2000 - 2008, Incumbent Since 2012))

572

438

Listed In: Leaders

Birthdate: October 7, 1952

Sun Sign: Libra

The current President of Russia, Vladimir Putin is a popular politician, with the highest approval rating of any leader in the world as of July 2020. As a high-level politician who has the support of his citizens, he is a powerful figure in world politics. He has been accused by human rights organizations of persecuting political critics and activists.

Recommended Lists:

4

Anna Pavlova

(Russian Ballerina and One of the Most-Celebrated Ballet Dancers of Her Time)

57

8

Listed In: Dancers

Birthdate: February 12, 1881

Sun Sign: Aquarius

Died: January 23, 1931

One of the first ballerinas to travel extensively around the world, Anna Pavlova had first gained an interest in the dance form after watching an adaptation of The Sleeping Beauty. She initially gained fame dancing with Mikhail Mordkin and later made waves with her iconic role in The Dying Swan.

Recommended Lists:

5

Nicholas II

(Emperor of Russia (1894 - 1917))

91

48

Listed In: Historical Personalities

Birthdate: May 18, 1868

Sun Sign: Taurus

Died: July 17, 1918

Nicholas II reigned as the last Emperor of All Russia from 1894 until his abdication in 1917. His reign oversaw a series of reforms in Russia. These reforms included the introduction of literacy programs, civil liberties, and methods to modernize the empire's infrastructure. However, these reforms were eventually undermined by Nicholas' love for autocratic rule.

6

Anton Yelchin

(American Actor Best Known for His Role as 'Pavel Chekov' in the 'Star Trek' Reboot Film Series)

56

32

Listed In: Film & Theater Personalities

Birthdate: March 11, 1989

Sun Sign: Pisces

Died: June 19, 2016

As an actor, who was also interested in photography and playing the guitar, Anton Yelchin was a man of many talents. Unfortunately, he was involved in a freak accident that killed him when he was 27. Such was his impact in Hollywood that a bronze statue of his was erected at his grave and many celebrities attended the unveiling ceremony.

Recommended Lists:

7

Mariya Putina

(Russian Pediatric Endocrinologist and Eldest Daughter of Russian President Vladimir Putin)

140

94

Listed In: Miscellaneous

Birthdate: April 28, 1985

Sun Sign: Taurus

Maria Vorontsova, the eldest daughter of Russian president Vladimir Putin, is a pediatric endocrinologist and Putin's advisor in genetic engineering. She has also co-written a book on idiopathic stunting in kids. She is currently a PhD candidate at Moscow’s Endocrinology Research Centre and is married to Dutch entrepreneur Jorrit Faassen.

8

Grand Duchess Anastasia Nikolaevna of Russia

(Russia’s Grand Duchess and the Youngest Daughter of Tsar Nicholas II, Last Emperor)

50

17

Listed In: Miscellaneous

Birthdate: June 18, 1901

Sun Sign: Gemini

Died: July 17, 1918

Grand Duchess Anastasia Nikolaevna of Russia was the youngest daughter of Tsar Nicholas II. She was assassinated by the Bolsheviks in July 1918. However, rumors of her escape sprung up later, with many imposters claiming to be Anastasia. Nevertheless, DNA tests have dismissed any chances of Anastasia’s survival.

Recommended Lists:

9

Boris Spassky

(Russian Chess Grandmaster)

8

5

Listed In: Sportspersons

Birthdate: January 30, 1937

Sun Sign: Aquarius

Boris Spassky is a Russian chess player who held the World Chess Championship title from 1969 to 1972. He was part of the famous World Chess Championship match in 1972 where he lost his championship title to Bobby Fischer of the United States. In Bobby Fischer's 2014 biopic Pawn Sacrifice, Boris Spassky is portrayed by American actor Isaac Liev Schreiber.

10

Dmitry Shostakovich

(One of the Major Russian Composers of the 20th Century)

44

7

Listed In: Musicians

Birthdate: September 25, 1906

Sun Sign: Libra

Died: August 9, 1975

Dmitry Shostakovich was a Soviet and Russian pianist and composer. Widely regarded as one of the 20th century's major composers, Shostakovich's music is characterized by ambivalent tonality, elements of the grotesque, and sharp contrasts. He composed 15 symphonies during his lifetime and most of his work came under Joseph Stalin.

Recommended Lists:

11

George Sanders

(Actor Known for His Films: 'Rebecca', 'Foreign Correspondent' and 'All About Eve')

31

9

Listed In: Film & Theater Personalities

Birthdate: July 3, 1906

Sun Sign: Cancer

Died: April 25, 1972

George Sanders was a British actor, music composer, singer-songwriter, and author. Characterized by his smooth bass voice and heavy English accent, Sanders often portrayed sophisticated but villainous roles. For his contribution to the film and TV industry, George Sanders was honored with a couple of stars on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

12

Alexander I of Russia

(Emperor of Russia from 1801 to 1825)

22

12

Listed In: Historical Personalities

Birthdate: December 23, 1777

Sun Sign: Capricorn

Died: December 1, 1825

Alexander I was the emperor of Russia and the eldest son of Paul I. While he was initially a friend of Napoleon Bonaparte, he later joined hands with his opponents to defeat him. He was also part of the Congress of Vienna and later contributed to the formation of the Holy Alliance.

Recommended Lists:

13

Alexei Nikolaevich, Tsarevich of Russia

(Prince of Russia from 1904 to 1918)

43

8

Listed In: Miscellaneous

Birthdate: August 12, 1904

Sun Sign: Leo

Died: July 17, 1918

Alexei Nikolaevich, Tsarevich of Russia was the heir apparent to the Russian Empire's throne. The only son of Empress Alexandra Feodorovna and Emperor Nicholas II, Alexei was born with haemophilia, which was treated by the popular faith healer Grigori Rasputin. In 1918, Alexei and his family members were executed brutally by Communist revolutionaries.

14

Alexander III of Russia

(Emperor of Russia (1881 - 1894))

15

11

Listed In: Historical Personalities

Birthdate: March 10, 1845

Sun Sign: Pisces

Died: November 1, 1894

Alexander III ruled as the emperor of Russia, the king Poland, and the grand duke of Finland, from 1881 to 1894. He reversed many liberal policies that had been implemented by his father, Alexander II, earlier. He passed the “May Laws” and did not participate in any major war.

Recommended Lists:

15

Nikolai Valuev

(The Tallest and Heaviest World Champion in Boxing History)

19

8

Listed In: Sportspersons

Birthdate: August 21, 1973

Sun Sign: Leo

The Russian Giant Nikolai Valuev has been the WBA heavyweight champion twice, and at 149 kg and 7 ft., is the heaviest and tallest champion ever. Severe health issues caused him to retire from boxing, following which he appeared in films such as Stonehead and became a State Duma member.

16

Andriy Yarmolenko

(Ukrainian Football Midfielder/Forward)

41

21

Listed In: Sportspersons

Birthdate: October 23, 1989

Sun Sign: Libra

Andriy Yarmolenko is a Ukrainian football player who plays as a forward or midfielder. He is the current captain of the Ukraine national football team. He is best known for his association with Dynamo Kyiv; he played for the team from 2008 to 2017. In 2013, 2014, 2015, and 2017, Andriy Yarmolenko was named Ukrainian Footballer of the Year.

Recommended Lists:

17

Margarita Levieva

(Russian-American Actress Known for Roles in the TV Series ‘Revenge’, ‘The Blacklist’ and ‘Allegiance’)

10

6

Listed In: Film & Theater Personalities

Birthdate: February 9, 1980

Sun Sign: Aquarius

Margarita Levieva is a Russian-American actress known for playing important roles in TV series like Vanished, How to Make It in America, Revenge, Allegiance, and The Deuce. Apart from being an actress, Levieva is also a dancer. She has also been training as a rhythmic gymnast since the age of three.

18

Grand Duchess Olga Nikolaevna of Russia

(Eldest Child of Emperor Nicholas II, and of Empress Alexandra of Russia)

22

10

Listed In: Miscellaneous

Birthdate: November 15, 1895

Sun Sign: Scorpio

Died: July 17, 1918

Height: 5'5" (165 cm)

Recommended Lists:

19

Galina Ulanova

(One of the Greatest Ballerinas of the 20th Century)

15

5

Listed In: Dancers

Birthdate: January 8, 1910

Sun Sign: Capricorn

Died: March 21, 1998

Born to dancer parents, Soviet ballerina Galina Ulanova was destined to follow in their footsteps. The dancer who had performed with both Mariinsky and Bolshoi theaters remains the only two-time Hero of Socialist Labour winner. She amazed audiences in Giselle, Swan Lake, and Romeo and Juliet.

20

Ivan VI of Russia

(Emperor of Russia)

17

7

Listed In: Historical Personalities

Birthdate: August 23, 1740

Sun Sign: Virgo

Died: July 16, 1764

The eldest child of Duke Anthony Ulrich and Duchess Anna Leopoldovna, Ivan VI of Russia, took over the throne as a 2-month-old baby, with his mother as the regent. His first cousin Elizabeth’s coup later resulted in his imprisonment for 20 years and his eventual assassination.

Recommended Lists:

21

Pavel Durov

(French entrepreneur who is best known for being the founder of the social networking site VK and later of Telegram Messenger)

3

0

Listed In: Scientists

Birthdate: October 10, 1984

Sun Sign: Libra

22

Viktor Tsoi

(Soviet Singer-Songwriter and Co-Founder of the Rock Band 'Kino')

29

10

Listed In: Musicians

Birthdate: June 21, 1962

Sun Sign: Gemini

Died: August 15, 1990

Viktor Tsoi, the lead singer of the legendary Russian rock band Kino, broke the hearts of his fans across the world when he died in a tragic car crash at age 28. A symbol of rebellion, Tsoi transformed rock music from an underground movement to a mainstream phenomenon in Russia.

Recommended Lists:

23

Grand Duchess Tatiana Nikolaevna of Russia

(Saint)

12

9

Listed In: Miscellaneous

Birthdate: June 10, 1897

Sun Sign: Gemini

Died: July 17, 1918

24

Felix Yusupov

(Prince of Russia)

9

1

Listed In: Historical Personalities

Birthdate: March 23, 1887

Sun Sign: Aries

Died: September 27, 1967

Felix Yusupov was a Russian prince and count from the Yusupov family. He participated in the assassination of the controversial mystic Grigori Rasputin. He was born into a wealthy family and led a flamboyant life. He was happily married to Princess Irina of Russia, the niece of Tsar Nicholas II, for more than 50 years.

Recommended Lists:

25

Grand Duke Michael Alexandrovich of Russia

(Russian Noble and Youngest Son of Emperor Alexander III of Russia)

8

4

Listed In: Miscellaneous

Birthdate: December 4, 1878

Sun Sign: Sagittarius

Died: June 13, 1918

Son of Alexander III, the emperor of Russia, Grand Duke Michael Alexandrovich refused to accept the throne unless Russians were allowed to decide if they wanted the monarchy or a republic. Both Michael and his British secretary, Nicholas Johnson, were arrested and shot to death during the Russian Revolution.

26

Dmitry Medvedev

(Prime Minister of Russia from 2012 to 2020 and President of Russia from 2008 to 2012)

8

8

Listed In: Leaders

Birthdate: September 14, 1965

Sun Sign: Virgo

Dmitry Medvedev, the Deputy Chairman of the Russian Security Council, has also been the prime minister and president of Russia. Born to teacher parents, he was an intelligent child and began studying his father’s encyclopedia in third grade. He is known for his support of the nuclear disarmament treaty.

Recommended Lists:

27

Sergei Krikalev

(Russian Retired Cosmonaut: Ranks Third for the Most Time Spent in Space)

8

1

Listed In: Miscellaneous

Birthdate: August 27, 1958

Sun Sign: Virgo

Soviet and Russian mechanical-engineer and retired cosmonaut Sergei Krikalev who spent 803 days, 9 hours and 39 minutes in space over the span of six spaceflights held the record of spending most time in space before his record was surpassed by Gennady Padalka on June 28, 2015. At present Krikalev ranks third in the list after Padalka and Yuri Malenchenko.

28

Tom Conway

(British Actor Best Known for His Portrayals of Private Detectives)

8

1

Listed In: Film & Theater Personalities

Birthdate: September 15, 1904

Sun Sign: Virgo

Died: April 22, 1967

Best known for playing detectives such as The Falcon and Sherlock Holmes, British actor Tom Conway also appeared in 2 Tarzan movies and a few Val Lewton cult horror movies. His performance in an episode of Alfred Hitchcock Presents was appreciated by critics. He also voiced a role in 101 Dalmatians.

Recommended Lists:

29

Viktor Korchnoi

(Soviet-Swiss Chess Grandmaster)

1

1

Listed In: Sportspersons

Birthdate: March 23, 1931

Sun Sign: Aries

Died: June 6, 2016

Viktor Korchnoi was a writer and chess grandmaster. He is widely regarded as one of the best players never to have achieved the World Chess Championship title. He played chess until old age and became the oldest player to be ranked in the top 100 players list when he won the World Senior Chess Championship in 2006 at age 75.

30

Peter Carl Fabergé

(Russian Jeweller Best Known for the Famous 'Fabergé Eggs' Made of Precious Metals and Gemstones)

24

4

Listed In: Fashion

Birthdate: May 30, 1846

Sun Sign: Gemini

Died: September 24, 1920

Apart from being the official jeweler of the Russian imperial court, Peter Carl Fabergé also created some of the most innovative jewelry designs, such as the iconic Fabergé eggs. He had also launched workshops in London, Moscow, and Kiev. Later, hounded by the revolutionary government, he fled to Switzerland.

Recommended Lists:

31

Nadezhda Konstantinovna Krupskaya

(Deputy Minister of Education in the Government of the Soviet Union 1929 – 1938)

6

4

Listed In: Leaders

Birthdate: February 26, 1869

Sun Sign: Pisces

Died: February 27, 1939

32

Joseph Brodsky

(Poet, Essayist and Winner of 1987 Nobel Prize in Literature)

8

2

Listed In: Writers

Birthdate: May 24, 1940

Sun Sign: Gemini

Died: January 28, 1996

Nobel Prize-winning Russian-American poet Joseph Brodsky is remembered for his elegiac and lyric poems. While he had started writing poems soon after leaving school, he was sentenced to hard labor by the Soviets for his irregular work record. He later moved to the U.S., where he taught at various universities.

Recommended Lists:

33

Andrey Arshavin

(Russian Former Professional Football Winger / Midfielder)

11

11

Listed In: Sportspersons

Birthdate: May 29, 1981

Sun Sign: Gemini

Andrey Arshavin is a Russian former football player who helped Zenit Saint Petersburg win several trophies, such as the League Cup, Russian Premier League, UEFA Cup, Russian Super Cup, and the UEFA Super Cup. He was also an important player for the Russian national football team and helped the team reach the semi-final of UEFA Euro 2008.

34

Nicholas Roerich

(Russian Painter, Archaeologist and Philosopher)

6

0

Listed In: Artists & Painters

Birthdate: October 9, 1874

Sun Sign: Libra

Died: December 13, 1947

Russian painter, writer, philosopher, theosophist and archaeologist, Nicholas Roerich, counted among the greatest Russian painters, is noted for initiating the modern movement for the defense of cultural objects. One of the greatest feats that he achieved during his lifetime was the Roerich Pact that was signed into law by the US and most nations of the Pan-American Union.

Recommended Lists:

35

Peter II of Russia

(Emperor of Russia (1727 - 1730))

3

3

Listed In: Historical Personalities

Birthdate: October 23, 1715

Sun Sign: Libra

Died: January 30, 1730

Peter II Alexeyevich, the only son of Tsarevich Alexei Petrovich, ruled as the emperor of Russia from 1727 to 1730. He became a Tsar as a child but died an untimely death due to small pox at 14, on the day that he had planned to marry Ekaterina Dolgorukova.

(Imperial Highness)

Died: July 17, 1918

Vladislav Doronin

(CEO of Aman Resorts)

1

1

44

Boris Strugatsky

(Authors)

5

1

Listed In: Writers

Birthdate: April 14, 1933

Sun Sign: Aries

Died: November 19, 2012

Recommended Lists:

45

Alexei Kosygin

(Chairman of the Council of Ministers of the Soviet Union from 1964 to 1980)

6

6

Listed In: Leaders

Birthdate: February 21, 1904

Sun Sign: Pisces

Died: December 18, 1980

Alexei Kosygin was a Soviet-Russian statesman who played an important role during the Cold War. From 1964 to 1980, Kosygin was the Premier of the Soviet Union, a position that enabled him to become one of the most influential policymakers in the Soviet Union during the mid-1960s. Today, Kosygin is considered a prominent figure in both Soviet and Russian history.

46

Grigory Sokolov

(Pianist)

1

1

Listed In: Musicians

Birthdate: April 18, 1950

Sun Sign: Aries

Recommended Lists:

47

Margarita Louis-Dreyfus

(Businesswoman)

4

4

Listed In: Business People

Birthdate: July 1, 1962

Sun Sign: Cancer

Born in Russia, Swiss billionaire Margarita Louis-Dreyfus initially studied law and economics. She became an heir to the agricultural and food-processing commodities giant Louis-Dreyfus group after her husband Robert Louis-Dreyfus’s death. At 53, she became a mother of twins, with her partner Philipp Hildebrand. She was featured on Forbes Billionaires 2021.

48

Konstantin Khabensky

(Known for His Portrayal of 'Anton Gorodetsky' in ‘Night Watch’ and ‘Day Watch’)

6

0

Listed In: Film & Theater Personalities

Birthdate: January 11, 1972

Sun Sign: Capricorn

Konstantin Yurievich Khabensky, PAR, counted among the most acclaimed actors in Russia, gained international attention playing protagonist, Anton Gorodetsky in the film Night Watch and its sequel Day Watch. As a theatre actor Khabensky remained part of Saint Petersburg Lensoviet Theatre and is presently associated with Moscow Art Theatre. The Russian war-drama film Sobibor marked the directorial debut of Khabensky.

Recommended Lists:

49

Grand Duchess Elena Vladimirovna of Russia

(Grand Duchess of Russia)

6

4

Listed In: Miscellaneous

Birthdate: January 29, 1882

Sun Sign: Aquarius

Died: March 13, 1957

Grand Duchess Elena Vladimirovna of Russia was the youngest child of Grand Duke Vladimir Alexandrovich of Russia and Duchess Marie of Mecklenburg-Schwerin. Her marriage was arranged with Prince Nicholas of Greece and Denmark, and the wedding took place in 1902. The couple had three daughters. The duchess became involved in charity work later in life.

50

Svetlana Kuznetsova

(Russian Professional Tennis Player)

0

2

Listed In: Sportspersons

Birthdate: June 27, 1985

Sun Sign: Cancer

Russian tennis star Svetlana Kuznetsova is known for her two Grand Slam wins in both the singles and the doubles categories. She created history by becoming the first Russian to earn a US Open title. She has a star cyclist mother, Galina Tsareva, and an Olympic medalist brother, Nikolay Kuznetsov.
